title: Lee Bong-ryun
text:
Lee Bong-ryun (born February 7, 1981) is a South Korean actress. She has appeared in supporting roles in various films and television dramas, but is better known for her work as a stage actor.
Career.
Lee Bong-ryun began her career in theatre by chance while completing her master's degree in Photography at <a href="Chung-Ang%20University">Chung-Ang University</a>, when a lecturer who was also a stage director asked her to help as an assistant director for a play. The same year, in 2005, she made her acting debut with a minor role in the musical "Five Drawings of Love". Since then, she has appeared in various plays and musicals. 
She has been a frequent cast member in productions staged by the <a href="National%20Theater%20Company%20of%20Korea">National Theater Company of Korea</a> and was most recently cast as Princess Hamlet in the gender-swapped production of Shakespeare's "<a href="Hamlet">Hamlet</a>" in 2020.
In November 2021, Lee signed with AM Entertainment.
